title: Nutritional benefits, ethnomedicinal uses, phytochemistry, pharmacological properties and toxicity of Spondias mombin Linn: a comprehensive review
author: Ogunro; Olalekan Bukunmi; Oyeyinka; Barnabas Oluwatomide; Gyebi; Gideon Ampoma; Batiha; Gaber El-Saber
description: AbstractObjectives. Spondias mombin is traditionally used as an herbal medicine for several human diseases and ailments in the tropical regions across the globe
cleaned_text: Abstract Objectives Spondias mombin is traditionally used as an herbal medicine human diseases and ailments in the tropical regions across the globe including the African countries. This gathered from documented literatures in scientific database. Key findings The study revealed that S. mombin has nutritional values; with the leaf, fruit, flower, seed, and stem bark possessing a wide range and pharmacological activities. About 102 isolated compounds from the leaf, fruit, or stem bark of S. mombin have been reported. Search Strategy A review of scientific literature was compiled from the scientific database (such as Science Direct, Espacenet Web of Science, SciFinder, Scopus, PubMed, Scielo, Google Scholar, Google Patents, Springerlink, Mendeley) sources such as The Plant ( [http://www.theplantlist.org](http://www.theplantlist.org)), The International Plant Names Index ( [www.ipni.org](http://www.ipni.org)) and Plant Resources of Tropical Africa. Relevant and useful details (in relation to the botany and names, herbal properties and medicinal uses, phytochemistry as citation tracking from other publications, or by direct access to journal webpages. Keywords used for the identification of useful data are different scientific names, articles published between 1950 and 2022. Literature search was English language-based, except in a few cases of Portuguese and was translated to the English language.
